channel.title: How could I do this?
channel.description:
Would there be a way to make a text box and when someone types something in it and hits submit the information either gets sent to a notepad on my computer or to a html/php document
All help is greatly appreciated.

item.title: How could I do this?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

TabbyKiller, don’t post anything to do with phishers here, even if you don’t intend to use it for bad reasons we don’t want to have that sort of stuff here.

P.s. I’ve let you off lightly with a verbal warning so take heed!

P.s.s. To everyone else: I’ve let him off lightly because the actual phisher website looked shit and anyone falling for it kind of deserved to have shit done to their account.

Read full topic

item.title: How could I do this?
item.dc:creator: @Wewt Wewt
item.description:
@Wewt wrote:

You may want to change the textarea name to “stuff” not “stuff.php”. Everything else will work great, however.
What’s your site?

Read full topic

item.title: How could I do this?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:5, topic:330553”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=426929.msg3142956#msg3142956 date=1267777005]

[code=php]<?php
if (isset($_POST[‘stuff’])) {
file_put_contents(‘file.php’, $_POST[‘stuff’], FILE_APPEND);
}
else {
?>


<?php } ?>[/code]

Make sure you send us the site when it’s all done :D.

PS: syntax highlight fail’d

Simplify please?
[/quote]what…

thats what u want bro[/quote]
0.0 lol thanks, before when I tried it came up with a unexpected { and stuff, turns out that the code layout has to be exact.

Thanks guys

Read full topic
